item.title: New Pokemon: Legends Z-A Trailer Reveals Its Big Twist On Gameplay
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-pokemon-legends-z-a-trailer-reveals-its-big-twist-on-gameplay/1100-6530425/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The next entry in the Pokemon series, Pokemon Legends: Z-A, finally has a new trailer showcasing its core gameplay mechanic: the Z-A Royale.

Revealed during March 27's Nintendo Direct, Pokemon Legends: Z-A's new gameplay twist takes place after the sun sets upon Lumiose City. Though the urban sprawl might be peaceful by day, at night the city takes on a different aura as highly skilled trainers wander the streets, eager to battle and rank up in the Z-A Royale.

As a Lumoise City newcomer, your trainer will enter the tournament at Rank Z and be forced to duke it out at night in order to become Rank A. Though the trailer didn't reveal everything that comes with earning this coveted title, it did share that trainers who reach the top are "said to have a wish granted."

Like Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Wild Zones, these dusk-'til-dawn duels will be contained to designated areas called Battle Zones, which will be indicated by red, holographic borders. Once your trainer steps foot in these areas, other trainers will be eager to challenge them, making timing and the way you approach certain opponents critical to success.

The French-inspired Lumiose City, which serves as the Kalos region's main hub, will be familiar to those who played Pokemon X and Y. However, Legends Z-A further realizes the location by greatly expanding it and adding in plenty of new characters, new locations, and wild Pokemon. Players will be able to battle and capture these wild Pokemon regardless of if they are tucked away in one of the city's Wild Zones or lurking up on the rooftops.

Pokemon: Legends Z-A is the second entry in the Pokemon: Legends spin-off sub-series. While the mainline Pokemon series sees players traverse an entire region, battling gym leaders to earn the title of Pokemon Master, the Legends series confines players to a more fully realized version of a particular location. In Pokemon Legends: Arceus, players traveled back in time to the settlement of the Sinnoh region. In GameSpot's Pokemon Legends: Arceus review, we wrote that the game is a "significant reimagining of what makes a Pokemon game, with an exciting level of flexibility."

According to the game's press release, Pokemon Legends: Z-A is currently scheduled to launch on the "Nintendo Switch family of systems" in late 2025. Though additional information on Pokemon Legends: Z-A is scarce, those eager to learn more can check out our overview of the game's three starter Pokemon.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered Is Out Today On Nintendo Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/saga-frontier-2-remastered-is-out-today-on-nintendo-switch/1100-6530429/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After 25 years, Square Enix is breathing new life into a classic RPG with the reveal of SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered. Originally a PlayStation exclusive, the new version of the game will launch today on Nintendo Switch, PC, PS4, PS5, and mobile devices.

SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered was unveiled at today's Nintendo Direct. Square Enix is adding brand-new events to the RPG, alongside the ability to "team up with more characters in battle," per the trailer (seen below). SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered is also promising quality-of-life improvements.

The beloved RPG returns -- fully remastered for modern platforms!
SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered brings back its signature watercolor visuals, deep strategic battles, and entwined narratives, now with quality of life improvements, new story events, and more. pic.twitter.com/wrwxDbHwkl

â€” SaGa Series @ #SaGaFrontier2 available today! (@SaGaGame) March 27, 2025

The RPG first launched for PlayStation in 2000 for North American audiences (1999 in Japan) and follows two protagonists: Gustave and William Knights. SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered, like the original, lets you choose from various events in Sandail's history. The user-interface has been improved for this new version, according to the Square Enix website. Another addition will be postgame content, such as the opportunity to "fight enhanced bosses as extra battle content."

Almost four years ago, SaGa Frontier Remastered was announced. Meanwhile, the sequel wasn't the only Square Enix RPG remaster getting some spotlight at today's Nintendo Direct, either. Dragon Quest 1 and 2 HD Remake also got highlighted and will arrive later this year. To keep up with more Switch news, Nintendo rolled out the Nintendo Today app for smartphones.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 Community Edition Mod Adds Over 60 Playable Characters
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ultimate-marvel-vs-capcom-3-community-edition-mod-adds-over-60-playable-characters/1100-6530418/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Back in August 2023, a massive modding project for Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3--known as the Community Edition--was announced by members of the UMvC3 modding community. Today, the team behind the mods has announced that the full version of Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 Community Edition is now available to download--and it's brought nearly 70 new characters to the game.

The modders released a new trailer to celebrate the launch of the mod, which showcases a few of the most recent characters modded into the game. Rival Schools's Kyosuke Kagami, Devil May Cry's Nero, and Bad Box Art Megaman--complete with a realistic German Shepherd version of Rush--are all included in the video.

The Community Edition modders have slowly added characters to the game since that initial 2023 announcement, but the pack released today adds 67 different fighters to the playable roster, each with unique moves, animations, and more. The mod's NexusMods listing also includes full movelists for each of the new additions for those interested in testing out some of the newest names.

The full list of characters added to Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 through the Community Edition mod is as follows:

  • Capcom
    • Shadow Lady
    • Evil Ryu
    • Lilith
    • S.T.A.R.S. Wesker
    • Phoenix & Maya
    • Shin Akuma
    • Chris (S.T.A.R.S)
    • Ken
    • DMC 1 Dante
    • Rashid
    • Monster Hunter
    • HUNK
    • Cammy
    • Asura
    • Guile
    • Charlie
    • Leon
    • Krauser
    • Jake
    • Sherry
    • Sakura
    • Batsu
    • Captain Commando
    • Talbain
    • Megaman X
    • Jill (S.T.A.R.S.)
    • Servbot
    • Dan Hibiki
    • Gloria
    • DMC5 Vergil
    • Nero
    • Strider 2099
    • M. Bison
    • Hinata
    • Hayato
    • Kyosuke
    • Saki
    • Yun
    • Bad Box Art Mega Man
    • Juri
  • Marvel
    • Orange Hulk
    • Spider-Gwen
    • All New Wolverine
    • Red She-Hulk
    • Captain Marvel
    • MVC2 Sentinel
    • Cyclops
    • Jean Grey
    • Thanos
    • Psylocke
    • Ultron
    • Moonstone
    • Bishop
    • IceMan
    • Gambit
    • Venom
    • Carnage
    • Shocker
    • Blackheart
    • King Thor
    • Stranger
    • US Agent
    • Clea
    • The Thing
    • Colossus
    • Onslaught
    • Carter Slade
    • War Machine

Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 Community Edition is available to download now, though it will require the PC version of the base game to install.

Jason Fanelli on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
